title: Alphazet
author: Alphazet
content: Hi everyone can you share Useful Links for Beginners !  By helping me you will help other people tooThanks in advance

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: here Newbies - Read before posting, that is basically what a newbie needs if they are new to the forum, but it would be better if you can specify what exactly is it that you are looking for, members might be able share what exactly is that you are looking for.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.created_time: November 20, 2023, 08:41:23 PMLast edit: November 20, 2023, 08:54:06 PM by Frankolala
comments.body: You can start with thesewww.learnmeabitcoin.comhttps://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbookTo know more about the wallet to chooseBitcoin wallet- which,what,whyFor questions and answerhttps://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: Alphazet on November 20, 2023, 08:22:53 PMHi everyone can you share Useful Links for Beginners !  By helping me you will help other people tooThanks in advance This board is actually a great resource for crypto newbies.  If you browse through the different threads here, there are tons of useful links people have already suggested.  We shouldnt need to keep repeating the same stuff over and over for each new person - take a little time, like 15 minutes, to explore what was already been posted.  Show some motivation to find answers yourself first before asking to be spoon-fed info.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5472351.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5472566.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5472811.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5472853.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5472907.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5474677.0

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: Alphazet on November 20, 2023, 08:22:53 PMHi everyone can you share Useful Links for Beginners !  By helping me you will help other people tooThanks in advance Incase of next time you have to be specific on which aspect do you want to learn or enquiry of, we have the forum and the bitcoin network as a whole, being a newbie, you also need to know how to make use of the forum search engine on any relevant areas of your interest, here are few threads you can as well learn from.Helpful threads.Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0posting etiquetteshttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5184741.0#post_altgiveawayeverything you need to know about forum rank, activities and merits.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2766177.0bitcoin historyhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5438353.0

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Welcome to Bitcointalk forum mate. I would have provided the links but I already see it is given by another forum member and there's no point in posting the link again so, I'll just point out where to start first. First is to read the forum rules which is very important for everyone especially newbies that there are consequences when someone broke the forum rules or simply not following it like getting banned which is worse or like getting red tag or negative trust. After that, you can start learning about posting etiquette before reading about forum ranks and related informations. Good luck cheers!.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: QuoteUseful Links for Beginners !The title suggests that your thread has combined all the useful links for us to read. See if you can re-caption the thread.Quote from: Alphazet on November 20, 2023, 08:22:53 PMHi everyone can you share Useful Links for Beginners !  There are alot of links, just narrow it down to what you want and people can help. E.GLinks about the forum rules;Link about learning bitcoin;Etc

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Quote from: Alphazet on November 20, 2023, 08:22:53 PMHi everyone can you share Useful Links for Beginners !  Spend your precious time at least 1 week reading all those pinned topics in every section (especially on this Beginners & Help section), you will know everything that you wanted to know.  From forum rules and guidelines to cryptocurrency basic learning might you will learn if you are willing to spend your time reading. When I was new in crypto, this website https://bitcoin.org/en/ helped me to understand how Bitcoin works.It has also supported many languages so that you will know it easily. So welcome on board and I hope you will enjoy being here.

comments.author: Catenaccio
comments.body: Quote from: Alphazet on November 20, 2023, 08:22:53 PMHi everyone can you share Useful Links for Beginners !  You ask for very general, lack of details. What do you want?About forum thingsAbout Bitcoinor othersAbout forum things, you will get very helpful information for newbies in [Bitcointalk sticky threads] Newbies - read before starting.About Bitcoinhttps://github.com/igorbarinov/awesome-bitcoinhttps://github.com/SpiralDevelopment/Awesome-Crypto-TradingBitcoin for Beginners

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: Being a beginner on this forum, read first the forum rules so you know what you must follow and avoided. The links have already been given to you. Aside from that, you are on this section and check the threads that are on the stickies. They are helpful to someone who is starting out here.Also, be careful with links that you click. Hover it first to the link if it shows the real link through its appearance on the left/right bottom of your browser before clicking. Because someone might trick you with seems to be legitimate link but is modified through link editors or shortcut  links.

comments.author: DYING_S0UL
comments.created_time: November 21, 2023, 03:27:23 AMLast edit: November 21, 2023, 12:30:32 PM by DYING_S0UL
comments.body: Welcome to Bitcointalk. Check these threads, these might help. Everything is titled and listed below accordingly.Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQNewbies - Read before postingPosting techniqueMerit and rank requirementMake Your Topic Title, Posts More AttractiveTopic Title Style GuideAlso, here are some links if you wanna learn more of Bitcoin.https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chaptershttps://bitcoin.org/en/bitcoin-paperhttps://www.bitcoin.com/get-started/Note: Don't consume them all at once, take your time.

comments.author: YUriy1991
comments.body: I think the link that has been provided by @acroman08 is sufficient to represent the question you asked and the task is to learn one by one what everyone here has conveyed so that you don't get confused any more.

comments.author: Litzki1990
comments.body: There are many important topics created in the forum for newbies whose links have already been shared by many members here. As a new member you should read these topics carefully as well as who comments on such topics as a new member. As a new member, when you read these topics carefully, you will find many difficult topics easy. Simple things seem difficult to us in the new state but if we can trust ourselves and if we have enough faith that we can do everything right then the things in the first state will seem very easy for us.

comments.author: Lida93
comments.body: Welcome to the forum a community of bitcoin enthusiasts driven by shared knowledge. As you can see a lot of helpful links has been provided for your reading pleasure to guide and lead you within the forum. Learning is a gradual process, be rest assured you may not grab all you need at once but as time proceed you will get much acquainted with how the forum operates and bitcoin knowledge.As usual, my candid advice to you as a newbie disregard and never give audience to any PM's from anyone claiming to have a deal that can bring you profit or double your money in no time, a lot of Sam is going on behind the scene don't be a victim as newbie cause their targets usually newbies. So stay focus and avoid short-cuts to profits.

comments.author: Kelward
comments.body: Quote from: Alphazet on November 20, 2023, 08:22:53 PMHi everyone can you share Useful Links for Beginners !  By helping me you will help other people tooThanks in advance You're definitely in the right board to ask this important question, and since you didn't ask for a specific area of help, take your time and go through the bombardment of links that has been shared on this thread.I'll advice you to be active in the forum, go through different boards and check the topics there, if any one interests you, then you can read and learn, if you have any meaningful contributions to make, then you can go ahead. I believe that is the fastest way to learn about bitcoin and altcoins, because you can find threads that talks about important information that you've never thought about

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Quote from: Alphazet on November 20, 2023, 08:22:53 PMHi everyone can you share Useful Links for Beginners !  By helping me you will help other people tooThanks in advance You are the first dude I have seen here who did not say, I am new here or blah blah instead you are straightforward in knowing the useful links. Well, I have some links that I think will be of some use to you whether you are a newbie or not but the thing is there are tens of links I can give but can you read them all or just collect links?As reading all in a short period of time is a little difficult because you did not mention in which context you are looking for useful links because maybe the links I share might not be useful to you because you might be looking for links to grow fast and I might be giving links to what is trust system or merit system. Well, this following thread covers all the basic threads that a newbie should give a try.Comprehensive guide to Bitcointalk. Newbie friendly + calculator and infographic

comments.author: Ndabagi01
comments.body: Quote from: Alphazet on November 20, 2023, 08:22:53 PMHi everyone can you share Useful Links for Beginners !  By helping me you will help other people tooThanks in advance The links they supplied you will provide you with a proper guide in the forum if you read them carefully, understand what they imply, and use them as needed in the forum. You will have no trouble exploring the forum sites and learning new things if you follow the rules and instructions that guide it. Learning through the links provided is only one method; try to conduct some self-learning as well to assist you improve your knowledge and awareness of the bitcoin forum and its ecosystem. Those that study outside of typical class hours are the most successful. By asking this question, you've demonstrated that you're eager to learn new things here, and I wish you an exciting journey in this path.

comments.author: SmartCharpa
comments.body: Quote from: Alphazet on November 20, 2023, 08:22:53 PMHi everyone can you share Useful Links for Beginners !  By helping me you will help other people tooThanks in advance You can go through all of the links that have been provided to you, they will be very helpful to you. However, please make sure that you do not spam or plagiarize on the forum; failing to do so could result in the loss of your account. Additionally, you should not be too lazy to click through the links; learning more about bitcoin is important, and following to the guidelines provided on the forum is the most important thing to do here. Not all links will be provided to you; if you're looking for information, use the search option to find it. If there's anything you don't understand, don't be afraid to ask; high ranks are available. However, before you ask, make sure you've clicked through all of the links given to you, because some beginners are truly lazy when it comes to clicking through links. Do your best, though, and you'll find what you're looking for.

comments.author: $crypto$
comments.body: Quote from: Alphazet on November 20, 2023, 08:22:53 PMHi everyone can you share Useful Links for Beginners !  By helping me you will help other people tooThanks in advance Some members have shared useful links for you especially other beginners, then browse this forum with the search field may help you find the thread you need, but at least you have to spend a lot of time to learn so that you will understand what you need including initial learning on the forum, learning bitcoin, to the wallet you need you will find it here.Especially if you are a beginner who does not know anything then you should read the forum rules, if you violate you can be banned.

comments.author: mvdheuvel1983
comments.body: Quote from: Alphazet on November 20, 2023, 08:22:53 PMHi everyone can you share Useful Links for Beginners !  By helping me you will help other people tooThanks in advance Do you mean useful links for beginners on the forum or beginners to bitcoin.Helpful links have already been shared and I noticed that they are all text links. Here is a video resource. I enjoy listening to Andreas Antonopoulos - https://www.youtube.com/@aantonopThat's his YouTube packed with gems for Bitcoin curious and beginners like you.
